title: IPC
children: Our main source used for model training and development. Integrated Food Security Phases Classification (IPC) provided testing data and standards for determining food security risk levels in high risk countries.

title: GLAD
children: Provided satellite imagery that creates a map of global crop-cover. Crop-cover could be a key link to agricultural product and help asses food scarcity risk levels.

title: OpenStreetMap
children: Provides polygon data and open source mapping technology to create an interactive map. Also provided metrics on food storage density and transport as features for our model.

title: ACLED
children: The Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED) collects real-time data on the location, dates, actors, fatalities, and reported political violence and protest events worldwide, recorded in incident reports.

title: FAO
children: The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations provides yearly reports on the state of food wastage around the globe.

title: GEMS Informatics
children: The University of Minnesota's GEMS Informatics API collects accurate geographic information on the climatic potential for the establishment of a given crop pest threat.
